title: Juggernauts are the most frustrating champs to play against imo
body:
Honestly yes sometimes assassins are big  annoying. 
Sure fighters and adcs are sometimes annoying. But honestly, for the most part they all fall under the gauge of "these champs do lots of damage but they are squishy!" Now it's my personal OPINION, not fact, that champions that are building primarily tank items (i.e items that don't offer significant damage) should not be bursting, at all, ever. unless maybe it's like they are lv 18 and fighting a lv 11 champ.

Volibear at level 10, did 1234 damage in 0/94 seconds and his exact build was {{item:1401}} {{item:1031}} {{item:1011}}  {{item:3047}} . I was playing eve yes im fully aware she is squishy. But a champion with 0 mr items is out bursting me? Doubling my damage? Not even that. Like frankly i dont care about eve not winning the 1v1 like it's the fact that volibear bursted me down, with literally not a single damage item. He also did most damage on his team. So it's really really ridiculous because like why let a champion sit there and do that much damage while also building purely tank. End game the only actual damage items he had was f.m and deadmans "im only putting deadmans in as offensive because the ONE person is gonna say it's a damage item because it does like 60 magic damage.

This is just one experience but im pretty sure darius falls under this category as well and not only does he do fuck tons of damage but hes also mobile as shit. It really bothers me that top lane gets so much leniency on what gets to stay ridiculous to play against

I have another argument for you. You say that champs shouldn't be tanky and deal lots of damage (the entire concept of juggernauts). Ok.

But then, lets look at other scenarios and combinations. 

Should a champ be mobile and deal damage? Should they not have to buy mobilty items then in order to be mobile if they do damage?

Should a champ be ranged and deal lots of damage? They already have lots of safety from range, why should they also deal lots of damage?

Should a champ have stealth and deal tons of damage (basically very hard to counter them since you can't SEE them until it's too late much of the time, aka, eve, shaco, twitch, etc)?

Now let's go further. Should a champ have tanky or defensive abilities, be highly mobile, have plenty of cc, have tons of burst, AND high dps, along with mixed damage? Does that sound familiar like, I dunno, jax or irelia or akali?

Sure akali's not tanky, but don't tell me even for a moment that she doesn't have plenty of defensive escape or prolonging tools. She can be at 5% hp, jump from a shroud and 100-0 the adc that's within 500-700 units of her shroud. She can also dash away. She even has a micro stun.

You can go on and on, but the fact is that, immobile champs that are able to build tanky while still dealing good damage is neither outrages nor unfair. I mean, what other purposes would those champs even serve? what reward would those champs have for being immobile? That they should do subpar CC and hit like a limp noodle while acting as less-than-great meatshields compared to say, ornn, tahm kench, shen, etc.?

In the sense that darius R resets if it kills someone, it is an execute because of the efficiency gained by doing so. In the sense of how much damage it does based on an opponent's hp, it is not an execute, so Deathburst is right in that sense.

It could be looked at either way.
It has additional effects for executing (Resetting and fearing minions) but is technically not an execute in the sense of Riven's or Garen's ult.

Yeah, you really know very little about Darius. Darius hardly builds Cleaver anymore. Likewise all of the things you mentioned are things Darius has to either build or take with him at the start of the game. Illaoi and Mordekaiser can take those same spells and build those same items as well, but generally don't because they don't need to. They function differently in teamfights because building movement speed isn't as important on them. It IS important for Darius not because he becomes super OP broken please nerf, but because without them he will often get focused, locked down, and die without doing anything meaningful in return.

They can also take ghost. They also tend to have more innate mobility. In fact, some even have better MS item options. Just look at Jhin. Have you ever seen the ones with two or three MS boosting crit items, which, on top of his passive MS boost on 4th AA and his excellent range and root and aoe slow, makes him incredibly difficult for someone like darius to approach even WITH flash and ghost (because remember, it's not darius's fault if jhin doesn't have flash up as well).

Also, when darius builds righteous glory AND deadmans, he sacrfices: better tank stats of items like randuins, OR damage. Because standard Darius build will include things like:

Cleaver/Triforce, Ninja/merc treads, randuins/thornmail, sterak's gauge, deadman's, righteous, deaths dance, and possibly titanic hydra. There are of course some other options like sometimes you can take adaptive helm. But otherwise, if you noticed, darius can basically go either highly tanky stats with less burst and mobility, or more mobility, but somewhat less tanky and less damage, or more damage with less tankiness. He can't have them all. If darius takes deadmans AND righteous glory, he's sacrificing a lot of other stats, which means: he'll do less upfront burst and he won't be able to take as much dps, especially against crits and %hp on-hit effects like BORK.

He doesn't do the same burst though. He has a high hp pool and more resistances. So if you deal half his hp and he deals 100% of yours, he's doing so because you have half his hp and less resistances to mitigate his damage. In other words, if you got rid of resistances and gave each other the same HP Pool of about 2000, you might have actually killed him sooner.
